subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
Inconclusive. In the oracle bone and bronze scripts, the most common form was {{Han compound|日|東|t1=sun|t2=bag; east}}. Here are a few proposed interpretations as an {{liushu|ic|nocap=1}}:

* {{zh-l|*日}} was sometimes replaced with {{zh-l|*田}}, so {{w|Qiu Xigui}} thinks that it may be the original character of {{och-l|糧|grain field}}.
* {{w|Yu Xingwu}} interprets it as measuring something under the sun.
* {{w|Guo Moruo}} interprets it as the sun rising in the east – original character of {{och-l|亮}}.

{{w|Shuowen}} interprets this as a {{Han compound|曏|重|ls=psc|c1=p|t2=weight; heavy|nocap=1}}.
